definitions: a chemical substance used to preserve or stabilize biological material prior to microscopy or other examination
shortDefinitions: chemical substance for preserving biological material

definitions: a substance used to stabilize the volatile components of perfume

examples.text: sandalwood is regarded by many perfumers as a good fixative

shortDefinitions: substance for stabilizing perfume's volatile components

definitions: a liquid sprayed on to a pastel or charcoal drawing to fix colors or prevent smudging

examples.text: he sprayed his design with fixative

shortDefinitions: liquid sprayed on drawing to prevent smudging

definitions: a substance used to keep things in position or stick them together

examples.text: the swift glues these thin twigs to a wall using its own saliva as a fixative

shortDefinitions: substance used to stick things together

definitions: (of a substance) used to fix or stabilize something.
shortDefinitions: used to fix or stabilize something
